verses.verse: "Do you <S%H2803>think<s%> this to be your <S%H4941>right,<s%> or do you <S%H559>say,<s%> <S%H6664><s%> 'My righteousness is more than <S%H410>God<s%>'s,'
That you <S%H559>ask,<s%> <S%H5532><s%> 'What advantage will it be to <S%H3276>you?<s%> What profit shall I <S%H2403>have,<s%> more than if I had sinned?'
I will <S%H7725>answer<s%> <S%H7453>you,<s%> and your companions with you.
<S%H5027>Look<s%> to the <S%H8064>heavens,<s%> and <S%H7200>see.<s%> <S%H7789>See<s%> the <S%H7834>skies,<s%> which are higher than <S%H1361>you.<s%>
If you have <S%H2398>sinned,<s%> what effect <S%H6466>do<s%> you have against <S%H6588>him?<s%> If your transgressions are <S%H7231>multiplied,<s%> what do you do to <S%H6213>him?<s%>
If you are <S%H6663>righteous,<s%> what do you <S%H5414>give<s%> <S%H3947>him?<s%> Or what does he receive from your <S%H3027>hand?<s%>
Your <S%H7562>wickedness<s%> may hurt a <S%H376>man<s%> as you <S%H6666>are,<s%> and your righteousness may profit a <S%H1121>son<s%> of <S%H120>man.<s%>
"By reason of the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of <S%H6217>oppressions<s%> they cry <S%H7768>out.<s%> They <S%H2199>cry<s%> for help by reason of the <S%H2220>arm<s%> of the <S%H7227>mighty.<s%>
But none <S%H559>says,<s%> <S%H433><s%> 'Where is God my <S%H6213>Maker,<s%> who <S%H5414>gives<s%> <S%H2158>songs<s%> in the <S%H3915>night,<s%>
who <S%H502>teaches<s%> us more than the <S%H929>animals<s%> of the <S%H776>earth,<s%> and makes us <S%H2449>wiser<s%> than the <S%H5775>birds<s%> of the <S%H8064>sky?<s%>'
There they <S%H6817>cry,<s%> but none gives <S%H6030>answer,<s%> <S%H6440>because<s%> of the <S%H1347>pride<s%> of evil <S%H7451>men.<s%>
Surely <S%H410>God<s%> will not <S%H8085>hear<s%> an <S%H7723>empty<s%> <S%H7706>cry,<s%> neither will the Almighty regard <S%H7789>it.<s%>
<S%H637>How<s%> much less when you <S%H559>say<s%> you <S%H7789>don't<s%> see <S%H1779>him.<s%> The cause is <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H2342>him,<s%> and you wait for him!
But <S%H6485>now,<s%> because he has not visited in his <S%H639>anger,<s%> neither does he <S%H3966>greatly<s%> <S%H3045>regard<s%> <S%H6580>arrogance.<s%>
Therefore <S%H347>Job<s%> <S%H6475>opens<s%> his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> with <S%H1892>empty<s%> <S%H3527>talk,<s%> and he multiplies <S%H4405>words<s%> <S%H1097>without<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge.<s%>"
